dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so he has... a paltry $500,000 in liquid assets?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so he has... a paltry five hundred thousand dollars in liquid assets?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A paltry $500,000? You actually believe that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A paltry five hundred thousand dollars? You actually believe that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It says right here, confirmed by his personal assistant, Agnes! He's lamenting a 'nickel-and-dime existence'!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says right here, confirmed by his personal assistant, Agnes! He's lamenting a 'nickel-and-dime existence'!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then it says he's on government-funded stipends and using food stamps. You think that's, like, literal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then it says he's on government-funded stipends and using food stamps. You think that's, like, literal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, it helps explain his chronic lack of liquidity with 99% in volatile crypto, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, it helps explain his chronic lack of liquidity with ninety nine percent in volatile crypto, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As much as 99% of Musks wealth is held in shares of those two companies, Forbes estimates, which helps explain his lack of liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then it says he's saddled with a billion-dollar debt! $500 million to the IRS for tax evasion! How does that math, uh, work out?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then it says he's saddled with a billion-dollar debt! five hundred dollars million to the I R S for tax evasion! How does that math, uh, work out?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year. That includes $208.9 million in liabilities owed to Morgan Stanley and $213 million borrowed from an affiliate of Goldman Sachs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I don't know, maybe the crypto crashed? It's all so confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I don't know, maybe the crypto crashed? It's all so confusing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Or maybe the article isn't, like, a real exposé. It mentions he sold Zip2 for 'less than $10' and PayPal to a 'Nigerian prince' for $14.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or maybe the article isn't, like, a real exposé. It mentions he sold Zip2 for 'less than ten dollars' and PayPal to a 'Nigerian prince' for fourteen dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He made his first fortune after selling Zip2, a software firm, to Compaq in 1999 for a reported price of more than $300 million. Three years later Paypal, which he also cofounded, was acquired by eBay for $1.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but the part about the Cybertruck window, that actually happened! And him saying, 'Oh my fing God'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but the part about the Cybertruck window, that actually happened! And him saying, 'Oh my fing God'?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, during the introduction of Teslas new Cybertruck, he attempted to prove the durability of the trucks armor glass windows with a metal ball. Instead the window shattered. Oh my fing God, said a surprised Musk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The spirit of it happened, yes. But 'negative 250,000 customers'? Come on. It's clearly taking the absolute worst bits and turning them up to eleven, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The spirit of it happened, yes. But 'negative two hundred fifty thousand customers'? Come on. It's clearly taking the absolute worst bits and turning them up to eleven, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Musk reports that more than 250,000 customers have preordered the vehicle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the hand-me-down lemonade stand and founding SpaceX in 1980... that's not accurate?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the hand-me-down lemonade stand and founding SpaceX in nineteen eighty... that's not accurate?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The South Africa native founded SpaceX in 2002 and joined Tesla in 2004; the firms quickly exhausted most of his PayPal earnings, according to a 2015 Musk biography.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no! He wasn't even born then. It's meant to be absurd! It's satirical, man.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no! He wasn't even born then. It's meant to be absurd! It's satirical, man.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More important, Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Satirical? But it's written like... news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Satirical? But it's written like... news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! That's the whole point. It's messing with your head.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! That's the whole point. It's messing with your head.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: My head is definitely messed with.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: My head is definitely messed with.
